generatedFromSchema_doNotEdit.title: Item Kinetic Weapon
generatedFromSchema_doNotEdit.description: Allows an item to deal kinetic damage and its effects. This happens every tick while in use, in a straight line along the user's view vector, with damage computed based on both the user's and the target's velocity projected onto the view vector (via a dot product). The more the user and target move toward each other, and the more this movement is aligned with the user's view vector, the higher the damage. After "damage_multiplier" and "damage_modifier" are applied, the resulting damage is floored to the nearest lower integer.

fields.title: Creative Reach
fields.description: Defines the reach used when the user is in Creative Mode. Defaults to "reach" if unspecified.

fields.title: Damage Conditions
fields.description: Conditions that need to be satisfied for damage to be applied. If not specified, damage is not applied.

fields.title: Damage Modifier
fields.description: Value added to the the scaled dot product (after applying "damage_multiplier").

fields.title: Damage Multiplier
fields.description: Value multiplied to sum of the dot products of the user and target's velocity vectors projected onto the view vector.

fields.title: Delay
fields.description: Time, in ticks, after which kinetic damage and its effects start being applied.

fields.title: Dismount Conditions
fields.description: Conditions that need to be satisfied for riders to be dismounted. If not specified, riders cannot be dismounted.

fields.title: Hitbox Margin
fields.description: Added tolerance to the view vector raycast for detecting entity collisions.

fields.title: Knockback Conditions
fields.description: Conditions that need to be satisfied for knockback to be applied. If not specified, knockback is not applied.

fields.title: Reach
fields.description: Defines the range (in blocks) along the user's view vector where entities can be hit. Only targets within this distance are considered. Block collisions between the user and target block damage and its effects.
